column2: NEW YORK DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: New York
column6: NY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column6: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column8: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column10: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

column2: 2. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: there is a low place in the road.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 3. Which of the following is true about roundabouts?
column4: Roundabouts are also called 'open intersections' or 'uncontrolled intersections'.
column6: They give drivers less time to judge.

column2: 4. Expressway driving is different from normal driving because:
column4: there are no posted speed signs.
column6: it combines higher speeds with heavy traffic, and requires drivers to think faster.
column8: you need to come to a complete stop when driving in fog.

column2: 5. The law requires that your tires have at least _____ of an inch  of tread.
column4: 1⁄4th
column6: 2⁄32nds

column2: 6. What does a red arrow signal mean?
column4: After stopping, you may turn right if there is not a NO TURN ON RED sign and the way is clear.
column6: You may turn left from a one-way street onto a one-way street that has traffic moving to the left.
column8: Do not make the movement shown by the arrow until the green light appears.

column2: 7. Your headlights must be on low beam when you are within _______ of an oncoming vehicle.
column4: 300 feet
column6: 1000 feet

column2: 8. Driving within the range of your headlights indicates you can stop your vehicle within about how many feet?
9. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: before you enter the intersection.
column6: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column10: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 10. To reduce glare from the lights of following vehicles, you should:
column4: increase your speed to increase the distance between your vehicle and following vehicles.
column6: activate your flashing backlights.
column8: switch your interior rear view mirror to the “night” position.
column10: slow down and let the following vehicle pass.

column2: 11. If you refuse to take the chemical test after being arrested, your driver license will be:
column4: deleted.
column6: suspended.

column2: 12. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column6: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column10: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 13. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column6: they must turn around immediately.
column8: they must not drive past this sign.
column10: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.

column2: 14. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.
column6: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.

column2: 15. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles must keep left.
column6: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column10: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 16. Which of the following is NOT true about roundabouts:
column4: Drivers entering the roundabout have the right-of-way.
column6: Trucks are not allowed to enter roundabouts.
column10: They give drivers more time to judge.

column2: 17. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Rely on your mirrors.
column6: Look through your back window for children.
column8: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 18. Can drivers use hands-free telephone in New York State?
column4: Yes, if drivers use their hands only to begin and end the call.
column6: No, except for emergency calls.
column10: No, using a hands-free mobile telephone is a traffic violation.

column2: 19. What color and shape is a railroad crossing warning sign?
column4: Yellow, diamond.
column6: White, rectangle.

column2: 20. Driving drunk with a conditional license is:
column4: a bad habit.
column6: a traffic infraction.
